etymology.description: semantic: 言(言) (yán, "speech") + phonetic: 司(司) (sī, "manage") = word or term relating to speech -> simplified by replacing 言(言) (yán, "speech") with 讠(讠) (yán, "speech") -> final form 词(詞)
etymology.interpretation: The character 词(詞) (cí, "word; term") combines the speech radical 言(言) (yán, "speech") with 司(司) (sī, "manage") to indicate a managed or structured form of speech, i.e., a word or term. The simplified form retains this concept, making writing faster with 讠(讠) (yán, "speech") being a cursive form of the speech radical.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by changing the full radical 言(言) (yán, "speech") to its cursive form 讠(讠) (yán, "speech"), facilitating quicker writing while retaining the original meaning.

examples.chinese: 这个词意义丰富(這個詞意義豐富)。
examples.english: This word has a rich meaning.

examples.chinese: 诗歌中的每个词都富有韵律(詩歌中的每個詞都富有韻律)，展现了作者的才华(展現了作者的才華)。
examples.pinyin: Shīgē zhōng de měi ge cí dōu fùyǒu yùnlǜ, zhǎnxiànle zuòzhě de cáihuá.
